original: 1.      Description of the Promotion ---------------------------- PageMaster Corporation in conjunction with Go Call, shall offer free new Motorola "Wordline Alphanumeric" (or equal) pagers with no activation fee to all customers responding to this promotion who purchase twelve (12) months of numeric paging and airtime products and services from PageMaster Corporation ("Purchase Customers").
ollama_generated: 1.      Description of the Promotion ---------------------------- In response to customer demand, Go Call, in collaboration with PageMaster Corporation, will provide a complimentary Motorola "Wordline Alphanumeric" pager (or equivalent) with waived activation fees to any twelve (12)-month numeric paging and airtime product and service purchasers from PageMaster Corporation ("Qualifying Customers"), subject to the availability of stock. However, please note that while we strive to meet this offer, it is not binding on us unless confirmed in writing by a PageMaster Corporation representative.

original: 2.      Consumer Cost Description ------------------------- Each Purchase Customer will be required to purchase twelve months of local numeric airtime at a rate of $10.33 per month through a designated nationwide airtime provider, prepaid in advance. The purchased airtime shall be non-refundable to the consumer. Additionally, Purchase Customers will be required to pay for shipping and handling costs and applicable sales taxes based on their locations.
ollama_generated:
2.      Consumer Airtime Commitment ------------------------- As a Purchase Customer, you are expected to maintain an active local numeric airtime service for a period of twelve months, with each month's service costing $10.33. The selected nationwide airtime provider will bill you in advance for this service. Please note that these charges are non-refundable. Furthermore, you are responsible for covering any shipping and handling fees, as well as the sales taxes applicable to your location.

This revised clause aims to provide a more customer-friendly tone while maintaining the original legal requirements. It clarifies the cost structure and responsibility for additional costs such as taxes and shipping.

original: c.     PageMaster Corporation shall be responsible for all fulfillment obligations of this promotion relating to paging services, including, but not limited to, timely delivery of pagers, paging services, defective goods handling, subcontracting, deadlines, and handling of consumer and regulatory inquiries and complaints.
modified: d. Consumer, in engaging with this promotion for paging services offered by PageMaster Corporation, acknowledges and accepts responsibility for any associated fulfillment obligations, including timely receipt and use of provided pagers, addressing defective goods, meeting deadlines for subcontracting and consumer/regulatory inquiries or complaints. PageMaster Corporation shall merely provide the paging services and assist in resolving issues to the best of its ability under normal business operations.

original: e.     PageMaster Corporation shall not engage in the same or similar promotion with any other On-Line Casinos from June 1, 1999 through June 1, 2000.
modified: f. From June 1, 1999 to June 1, 2000, PageMaster Corporation reserves the right to participate in promotions with other On-Line Casinos, provided that such activities do not significantly overlap or mirror the promotional strategies utilized during this period by PageMaster Corporation's primary partnership, CasinoX.

original: 5.      Responsibilities of Go Call --------------------------- a.     Go Call shall prepare and distribute at its own expense, all advertising materials to be used for this promotion.
modified:
5. Advertising Materials - Go Call is granted the discretion to create, at its sole expense, the advertising materials required for this promotion; however, their distribution remains the responsibility of [Recipient's Name].

This revised clause shifts the responsibility of distributing the advertising materials from Go Call to the recipient, while keeping the creation of the materials with Go Call. This modification creates a more collaborative atmosphere and clarifies each party's responsibilities in the promotion.

original: a.     PageMaster Corporation shall refund to Go Call, $1.00 per pager on all pagers delivered to Purchase Customers pursuant to this promotion (net return) up to the maximum refund of $100,000.00.
ollama_generated: b.     Go Call has the right to claim from PageMaster Corporation a refund of $1.00 per pager, not exceeding a total of $100,000.00, for all pagers supplied under this promotion to our Purchase Customers, irrespective of the number of returns made by each customer. The responsibility for handling and processing these returns lies with PageMaster Corporation.

original: 10.     Force Majeure ------------- Neither party will be responsible for any delay or failure in performance of any part of&bbsp;this Agreement to the extent that such delay or failure is caused by any event beyond its control, which may include, but not be limited to, fire, flood, explosion, war, strike, embargo, government requirement, civil or military authority, and acts of God ("Conditions"). If any such Condition occurs, the party delayed or unable to perform shall promptly give notice to the other party and, if such Condition remains at the end of thirty (30) days thereafter, the party affected by the other party's delay or inability to perform may elect to terminate or suspend this Agreement or part thereof, and resume performance of this Agreement once the Condition ceases, with an option for the affected party to extend the period of this Agreement up to the length of time the Condition endured. PageMaster Corporation make no warranties, either express or implied, concerning the pagers or the transmission of pages by the airtime service provider, including warranties of merchantability or fitness for particular purpose. The parties agree that PageMaster Corporation shall not be liable for service interruptions in the telecommunications industry, capacity constraints or related problems, or for any act or omission of any other entity furnishing products or services to PageMaster Corporation. PageMaster Corporations' liability shall in no event exceed an amount equivalent to the amounts received by PageMaster Corporation hereunder.
ollama_generated: 10. Force Majeure Exception: Both parties are relieved from any obligations for delays or failures in executing any portion of this Agreement when such occurrences are attributed to unforeseeable events outside their control, which may comprise incidents like fire, flood, explosion, war, labor disputes, sanctions, governmental decree, or actions by civil or military authorities, and acts of nature ("Uncontrollable Circumstances"). If any Uncontrollable Circumstance arises, the affected party shall promptly inform the other party, and if the circumstance persists past a 30-day period, either party has the option to either temporarily suspend or permanently terminate this Agreement's relevant provisions, with the possibility of resuming performance once the Uncontrollable Circumstance subsides. The Service Provider makes no express or implied guarantees regarding the quality or suitability of the pagers or page transmission services provided by the airtime service provider, specifically excluding warranties for merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose. The parties acknowledge that the Service Provider shall not be held accountable for disruptions in the telecommunications sector, capacity constraints, or any problems stemming from these issues, as well as any action or inaction of entities providing products or services to the Service Provider. The Service Provider's liability shall never surpass an amount equivalent to the compensation received by the Service Provider under this Agreement.

original: 11.     Choice Of Law ------------- This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California, exclusive of conflicts of law principles, and will, to the maximum extent practicable, be deemed to call for performance in Los Angeles County, California. Los Angeles County, California shall be the sole and exclusive venue for any litigation or dispute resolution relating to or arising out of the Agreement. To seek or receive indemnification hereunder (i) the party seeking indemnification must have properly notified the other party of any claim or litigation of which it is aware to which the indemnification relates; and the party seeking indemnification must have afforded the other the opportunity to participate in any compromise, settlement, litigation or other resolution or disposition of such claim or litigation.
ollama_generated: 11. Governing Law and Venue ------------ This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted under the laws of the State of California, setting aside any principles addressing conflicts of law, with a preference for actions related to or stemming from this Agreement to be resolved within Los Angeles County, California. Any legal action or dispute resolution concerning or arising out of this Agreement will take place in Los Angeles County, California. The party in need of indemnification shall promptly notify the other party of any claim or litigation connected to the indemnification, and afford the notified party a chance to participate in any negotiations, settlements, or legal proceedings associated with such claim or litigation prior to seeking or receiving indemnification. The other party will have the right to assume control of any compromise, settlement, or resolution of the claim or litigation.

original: c.     If the negotiations do not resolve the dispute within sixty (60) days of the initial written request, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration by a single arbitrator pursuant to the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association. A party may demand such arbitration in accordance with the procedures set out in those rules. Discovery shall be controlled by the arbitrator and shall be permitted to the extent set out in this Section. Each party may submit in writing to a party, and that party shall so respond, to a maximum of any combination of thirty-five (35) (none of which may have subparts) of the following: interrogatories, demands to produce documents and requests for admission. Each party is also entitled to take the oral deposition of one (1) individual of another party.
ollama_generated:
d. In the event that the negotiations fail to settle the dispute within sixty (60) days following the submission of the initial written request, either party may unilaterally initiate binding arbitration by a single arbitrator under the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association. The scope and extent of discovery will be determined solely by the arbitrator.

Initially, each party may submit in writing to the other party, who shall respond within a reasonable timeframe, up to thirty-five (35) questions or requests combined, which may consist of interrogatories, demands for production of documents, and requests for admission. It is noted that no subparts are allowed within these requests.

Moreover, each party retains the right to take the oral deposition of a single representative from the other party at their discretion. The procedures for initiating and responding to these requests will follow the guidelines set out in the arbitration rules.

original: 18.     Successors and Assigns ---------------------- This Agreement shall be binding upon, and shall inure to the benefit of the successors, heirs, administrators, trustees and assigns of the parties.
modified:
18. Non-Successors and Exclusions: This Agreement is not intended to be binding upon, nor does it grant any benefits to, the non-successors, personal representatives, beneficiaries, or assignees of the parties, unless specifically agreed in writing by all parties hereto.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility from being binding on successors to explicitly excluding them (non-successors), while requiring specific written agreement for the contract's benefits to extend to other parties. This change could potentially limit the transferability of the agreement or its obligations to third parties, unless expressly permitted by all involved parties.

original: 19.     Confidentiality --------------- The parties acknowledge that preparation for and execution of the promotion necessitates the exchange of confidential and proprietary information relating and belonging to the parties to this Agreement, as well as to other third parties integral to the promotion, including, without limitation, the pager manufacturer and the airtime supplier (herein "Information"). Each party agrees (1) to review, examine, inspect, obtain or utilize the information only for the purpose of this promotion, (2) to otherwise hold such Information strictly confidential, (3) to prevent the disclosure of such Information to nonessential third parties without a "need to know", and (4) to insure that each party's employees, agents and representatives and those of any integral third party understand and are bound by the confidentiality obligations of this Agreement. Each party shall indemnify the other party with respect to any loss or damage arising from the unauthorized disclosure or use of the Information by their respective employees, agents and representatives, or by those of any third party to whom such Information was disclosed. The agreements contained in this Paragraph shall survive the expiration, or termination of this Agreement. The panics hereby agree that subsequent to the expiration or termination of this Agreement, each party consents to the other party's use of its name only in connection with advertising to their respective trade or industry.
